title: (x) Neen logo - Lubalin Graph {Mark S}
content:
this artist is using many typefaces. looking through his site i was wondering which was this one.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080208043107im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/33867.gif)   
   
his adress is [http://www.neen.org/indexflash.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080208043107/http:/www.neen.org/indexflash.html)

 [‹ (x) West Coast Choppers - Ironwood {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080208043107/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4364 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Rotwild logo - custom (similar to Trican) {Romesh} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080208043107/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4328 "Go to next forum topic")
author: bender

comments.content:
Rockwell Bold with a slanted e?   
http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/rockwell-mt-2/rockwell-bold/

I think this is [Lubalin Graph](http://web.archive.org/web/20080208043107/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/itc-lubalin-graph/bold/testdrive.html?s=neen&p=48). There was an alternate slanted-crossbar e in it originally, but it's been left behind in all the digital versions that I know of.

Thanks karl, thanks mark. you're right it's the Lubalin Graph, i've tested it.   
Have a good day.
